00067 static int mdc_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd);
00068 
00069 static inline int mdc_queue_wait(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00070 {
00071         struct client_obd *cli = &req->rq_import->imp_obd->u.cli;
00072         int rc;
00073 
00074         /* obd_get_request_slot() ensures that this client has no more
00075          * than cl_max_rpcs_in_flight RPCs simultaneously inf light
00076          * against an MDT. */
00077         rc = obd_get_request_slot(cli);
00078         if (rc != 0)
00079                 return rc;
00080 
00081         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00082         obd_put_request_slot(cli);
00083 
00084         return rc;
00085 }
00086 
00087 /*
00088  * Send MDS_GET_ROOT RPC to fetch root FID.
00089  *
00090  * If \a fileset is not NULL it should contain a subdirectory off
00091  * the ROOT/ directory to be mounted on the client. Return the FID
00092  * of the subdirectory to the client to mount onto its mountpoint.
00093  *
00094  * \param[in]   imp     MDC import
00095  * \param[in]   fileset fileset name, which could be NULL
00096  * \param[out]  rootfid root FID of this mountpoint
00097  * \param[out]  pc      root capa will be unpacked and saved in this pointer
00098  *
00099  * \retval      0 on success, negative errno on failure
00100  */
00101 static int mdc_get_root(struct obd_export *exp, const char *fileset,
00102                          struct lu_fid *rootfid)
00103 {
00104         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00105         struct mdt_body         *body;
00106         int                      rc;
00107 
00108         ENTRY;
00109 
00110         if (fileset && !(exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_SUBTREE))
00111                 RETURN(-ENOTSUPP);
00112 
00113         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
00114                                 &RQF_MDS_GET_ROOT);
00115         if (req == NULL)
00116                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00117 
00118         if (fileset != NULL)
00119                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME, RCL_CLIENT,
00120                                      strlen(fileset) + 1);
00121         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_GET_ROOT);
00122         if (rc) {
00123                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00124                 RETURN(rc);
00125         }
00126         mdc_pack_body(req, NULL, 0, 0, -1, 0);
00127         if (fileset != NULL) {
00128                 char *name = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME);
00129 
00130                 memcpy(name, fileset, strlen(fileset));
00131         }
00132         lustre_msg_add_flags(req->rq_reqmsg, LUSTRE_IMP_FULL);
00133         req->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_FULL;
00134 
00135         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00136 
00137         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00138         if (rc)
00139                 GOTO(out, rc);
00140 
00141         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00142         if (body == NULL)
00143                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00144 
00145         *rootfid = body->mbo_fid1;
00146         CDEBUG(D_NET, "root fid="DFID", last_committed="LPU64"\n",
00147                PFID(rootfid), lustre_msg_get_last_committed(req->rq_repmsg));
00148         EXIT;
00149 out:
00150         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00151 
00152         return rc;
00153 }
00154 
00155 /*
00156  * This function now is known to always saying that it will receive 4 buffers
00157  * from server. Even for cases when acl_size and md_size is zero, RPC header
00158  * will contain 4 fields and RPC itself will contain zero size fields. This is
00159  * because mdt_getattr*() _always_ returns 4 fields, but if acl is not needed
00160  * and thus zero, it shrinks it, making zero size. The same story about
00161  * md_size. And this is course of problem when client waits for smaller number
00162  * of fields. This issue will be fixed later when client gets aware of RPC
00163  * layouts.  --umka
00164  */
00165 static int mdc_getattr_common(struct obd_export *exp,
00166                               struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00167 {
00168         struct req_capsule *pill = &req->rq_pill;
00169         struct mdt_body    *body;
00170         void               *eadata;
00171         int                 rc;
00172         ENTRY;
00173 
00174         /* Request message already built. */
00175         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00176         if (rc != 0)
00177                 RETURN(rc);
00178 
00179         /* sanity check for the reply */
00180         body = req_capsule_server_get(pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00181         if (body == NULL)
00182                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00183 
00184         CDEBUG(D_NET, "mode: %o\n", body->mbo_mode);
00185 
00186         mdc_update_max_ea_from_body(exp, body);
00187         if (body->mbo_eadatasize != 0) {
00188                 eadata = req_capsule_server_sized_get(pill, &RMF_MDT_MD,
00189                                                       body->mbo_eadatasize);
00190                 if (eadata == NULL)
00191                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00192         }
00193 
00194         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM) {
00195                 struct mdt_remote_perm *perm;
00196 
00197                 LASSERT(client_is_remote(exp));
00198                 perm = req_capsule_server_swab_get(pill, &RMF_ACL,
00199                                                 lustre_swab_mdt_remote_perm);
00200                 if (perm == NULL)
00201                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00202         }
00203 
00204         RETURN(0);
00205 }
00206 
00207 static int mdc_getattr(struct obd_export *exp, struct md_op_data *op_data,
00208                        struct ptlrpc_request **request)
00209 {
00210         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00211         int                    rc;
00212         ENTRY;
00213 
00214         /* Single MDS without an LMV case */
00215         if (op_data->op_flags & MF_GET_MDT_IDX) {
00216                 op_data->op_mds = 0;
00217                 RETURN(0);
00218         }
00219         *request = NULL;
00220         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_MDS_GETATTR);
00221         if (req == NULL)
00222                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00223 
00224         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_GETATTR);
00225         if (rc) {
00226                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00227                 RETURN(rc);
00228         }
00229 
00230         mdc_pack_body(req, &op_data->op_fid1, op_data->op_valid,
00231                       op_data->op_mode, -1, 0);
00232 
00233         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_MD, RCL_SERVER,
00234                              op_data->op_mode);
00235         if (op_data->op_valid & OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM) {
00236                 LASSERT(client_is_remote(exp));
00237                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_ACL, RCL_SERVER,
00238                                      sizeof(struct mdt_remote_perm));
00239         }
00240         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00241 
00242         rc = mdc_getattr_common(exp, req);
00243         if (rc)
00244                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00245         else
00246                 *request = req;
00247         RETURN(rc);
00248 }
00249 
00250 static int mdc_getattr_name(struct obd_export *exp, struct md_op_data *op_data,
00251                             struct ptlrpc_request **request)
00252 {
00253         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00254         int                    rc;
00255         ENTRY;
00256 
00257         *request = NULL;
00258         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
00259                                    &RQF_MDS_GETATTR_NAME);
00260         if (req == NULL)
00261                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00262 
00263         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME, RCL_CLIENT,
00264                              op_data->op_namelen + 1);
00265 
00266         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_GETATTR_NAME);
00267         if (rc) {
00268                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00269                 RETURN(rc);
00270         }
00271 
00272         mdc_pack_body(req, &op_data->op_fid1, op_data->op_valid,
00273                       op_data->op_mode, op_data->op_suppgids[0], 0);
00274 
00275         if (op_data->op_name) {
00276                 char *name = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME);
00277                 LASSERT(strnlen(op_data->op_name, op_data->op_namelen) ==
00278                                 op_data->op_namelen);
00279                 memcpy(name, op_data->op_name, op_data->op_namelen);
00280         }
00281 
00282         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_MD, RCL_SERVER,
00283                              op_data->op_mode);
00284         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00285 
00286         rc = mdc_getattr_common(exp, req);
00287         if (rc)
00288                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00289         else
00290                 *request = req;
00291         RETURN(rc);
00292 }
00293 
00294 static int mdc_xattr_common(struct obd_export *exp,const struct req_format *fmt,
00295                             const struct lu_fid *fid, int opcode, u64 valid,
00296                             const char *xattr_name, const char *input,
00297                             int input_size, int output_size, int flags,
00298                             __u32 suppgid, struct ptlrpc_request **request)
00299 {
00300         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00301         int   xattr_namelen = 0;
00302         char *tmp;
00303         int   rc;
00304         ENTRY;
00305 
00306         *request = NULL;
00307         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), fmt);
00308         if (req == NULL)
00309                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00310 
00311         if (xattr_name) {
00312                 xattr_namelen = strlen(xattr_name) + 1;
00313                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME, RCL_CLIENT,
00314                                      xattr_namelen);
00315         }
00316         if (input_size) {
00317                 LASSERT(input);
00318                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA, RCL_CLIENT,
00319                                      input_size);
00320         }
00321 
00322         /* Flush local XATTR locks to get rid of a possible cancel RPC */
00323         if (opcode == MDS_REINT && fid_is_sane(fid) &&
00324             exp->exp_connect_data.ocd_ibits_known & MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR) {
00325                 struct list_head cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
00326                 int count;
00327 
00328                 /* Without that packing would fail */
00329                 if (input_size == 0)
00330                         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA,
00331                                              RCL_CLIENT, 0);
00332 
00333                 count = mdc_resource_get_unused(exp, fid,
00334                                                 &cancels, LCK_EX,
00335                                                 MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR);
00336 
00337                 rc = mdc_prep_elc_req(exp, req, MDS_REINT, &cancels, count);
00338                 if (rc) {
00339                         ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00340                         RETURN(rc);
00341                 }
00342         } else {
00343                 rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, opcode);
00344                 if (rc) {
00345                         ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00346                         RETURN(rc);
00347                 }
00348         }
00349 
00350         if (opcode == MDS_REINT) {
00351                 struct mdt_rec_setxattr *rec;
00352 
00353                 CLASSERT(sizeof(struct mdt_rec_setxattr) ==
00354                          sizeof(struct mdt_rec_reint));
00355                 rec = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_REC_REINT);
00356                 rec->sx_opcode = REINT_SETXATTR;
00357                 rec->sx_fsuid  = from_kuid(&init_user_ns, current_fsuid());
00358                 rec->sx_fsgid  = from_kgid(&init_user_ns, current_fsgid());
00359                 rec->sx_cap    = cfs_curproc_cap_pack();
00360                 rec->sx_suppgid1 = suppgid;
00361                 rec->sx_suppgid2 = -1;
00362                 rec->sx_fid    = *fid;
00363                 rec->sx_valid  = valid | OBD_MD_FLCTIME;
00364                 rec->sx_time   = cfs_time_current_sec();
00365                 rec->sx_size   = output_size;
00366                 rec->sx_flags  = flags;
00367         } else {
00368                 mdc_pack_body(req, fid, valid, output_size, suppgid, flags);
00369         }
00370 
00371         if (xattr_name) {
00372                 tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME);
00373                 memcpy(tmp, xattr_name, xattr_namelen);
00374         }
00375         if (input_size) {
00376                 tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA);
00377                 memcpy(tmp, input, input_size);
00378         }
00379 
00380         if (req_capsule_has_field(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA, RCL_SERVER))
00381                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA,
00382                                      RCL_SERVER, output_size);
00383         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00384 
00385         /* make rpc */
00386         if (opcode == MDS_REINT)
00387                 mdc_get_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
00388 
00389         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00390 
00391         if (opcode == MDS_REINT)
00392                 mdc_put_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
00393 
00394         if (rc)
00395                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00396         else
00397                 *request = req;
00398         RETURN(rc);
00399 }
00400 
00401 static int mdc_setxattr(struct obd_export *exp, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00402                         u64 valid, const char *xattr_name,
00403                         const char *input, int input_size, int output_size,
00404                         int flags, __u32 suppgid,
00405                         struct ptlrpc_request **request)
00406 {
00407         return mdc_xattr_common(exp, &RQF_MDS_REINT_SETXATTR,
00408                                 fid, MDS_REINT, valid, xattr_name,
00409                                 input, input_size, output_size, flags,
00410                                 suppgid, request);
00411 }
00412 
00413 static int mdc_getxattr(struct obd_export *exp, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00414                         u64 valid, const char *xattr_name,
00415                         const char *input, int input_size, int output_size,
00416                         int flags, struct ptlrpc_request **request)
00417 {
00418         return mdc_xattr_common(exp, &RQF_MDS_GETXATTR,
00419                                 fid, MDS_GETXATTR, valid, xattr_name,
00420                                 input, input_size, output_size, flags,
00421                                 -1, request);
00422 }
00423 
00424 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00425 static int mdc_unpack_acl(struct ptlrpc_request *req, struct lustre_md *md)
00426 {
00427         struct req_capsule     *pill = &req->rq_pill;
00428         struct mdt_body        *body = md->body;
00429         struct posix_acl       *acl;
00430         void                   *buf;
00431         int                     rc;
00432         ENTRY;
00433 
00434         if (!body->mbo_aclsize)
00435                 RETURN(0);
00436 
00437         buf = req_capsule_server_sized_get(pill, &RMF_ACL, body->mbo_aclsize);
00438 
00439         if (!buf)
00440                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00441 
00442         acl = posix_acl_from_xattr(&init_user_ns, buf, body->mbo_aclsize);
00443         if (acl == NULL)
00444                 RETURN(0);
00445         if (IS_ERR(acl)) {
00446                 rc = PTR_ERR(acl);
00447                 CERROR("convert xattr to acl: %d\n", rc);
00448                 RETURN(rc);
00449         }
00450 
00451         rc = posix_acl_valid(acl);
00452         if (rc) {
00453                 CERROR("validate acl: %d\n", rc);
00454                 posix_acl_release(acl);
00455                 RETURN(rc);
00456         }
00457 
00458         md->posix_acl = acl;
00459         RETURN(0);
00460 }
00461 #else
00462 #define mdc_unpack_acl(req, md) 0
00463 #endif
00464 
00465 int mdc_get_lustre_md(struct obd_export *exp, struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00466                       struct obd_export *dt_exp, struct obd_export *md_exp,
00467                       struct lustre_md *md)
00468 {
00469         struct req_capsule *pill = &req->rq_pill;
00470         int rc;
00471         ENTRY;
00472 
00473         LASSERT(md);
00474         memset(md, 0, sizeof(*md));
00475 
00476         md->body = req_capsule_server_get(pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00477         LASSERT(md->body != NULL);
00478 
00479         if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLEASIZE) {
00480                 if (!S_ISREG(md->body->mbo_mode)) {
00481                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "OBD_MD_FLEASIZE set, should be a "
00482                                "regular file, but is not\n");
00483                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00484                 }
00485 
00486                 if (md->body->mbo_eadatasize == 0) {
00487                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "OBD_MD_FLEASIZE set, "
00488                                "but eadatasize 0\n");
00489                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00490                 }
00491 
00492                 md->layout.lb_len = md->body->mbo_eadatasize;
00493                 md->layout.lb_buf = req_capsule_server_sized_get(pill,
00494                                                         &RMF_MDT_MD,
00495                                                         md->layout.lb_len);
00496                 if (md->layout.lb_buf == NULL)
00497                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00498         } else if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLDIREA) {
00499                 const union lmv_mds_md *lmv;
00500                 size_t lmv_size;
00501 
00502                 if (!S_ISDIR(md->body->mbo_mode)) {
00503                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "OBD_MD_FLDIREA set, should be a "
00504                                "directory, but is not\n");
00505                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00506                 }
00507 
00508                 lmv_size = md->body->mbo_eadatasize;
00509                 if (lmv_size == 0) {
00510                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "OBD_MD_FLDIREA is set, "
00511                                "but eadatasize 0\n");
00512                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00513                 }
00514 
00515                 if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_MEA) {
00516                         lmv = req_capsule_server_sized_get(pill, &RMF_MDT_MD,
00517                                                            lmv_size);
00518                         if (lmv == NULL)
00519                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00520 
00521                         rc = md_unpackmd(md_exp, &md->lmv, lmv, lmv_size);
00522                         if (rc < 0)
00523                                 GOTO(out, rc);
00524 
00525                         if (rc < (typeof(rc))sizeof(*md->lmv)) {
00526                                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "size too small:  "
00527                                        "rc < sizeof(*md->lmv) (%d < %d)\n",
00528                                         rc, (int)sizeof(*md->lmv));
00529                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00530                         }
00531                 }
00532         }
00533         rc = 0;
00534 
00535         if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM) {
00536                 /* remote permission */
00537                 LASSERT(client_is_remote(exp));
00538                 md->remote_perm = req_capsule_server_swab_get(pill, &RMF_ACL,
00539                                                 lustre_swab_mdt_remote_perm);
00540                 if (!md->remote_perm)
00541                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00542         } else if (md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLACL) {
00543                 /* for ACL, it's possible that FLACL is set but aclsize is zero.
00544                  * only when aclsize != 0 there's an actual segment for ACL
00545                  * in reply buffer.
00546                  */
00547                 if (md->body->mbo_aclsize) {
00548                         rc = mdc_unpack_acl(req, md);
00549                         if (rc)
00550                                 GOTO(out, rc);
00551 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00552                 } else {
00553                         md->posix_acl = NULL;
00554 #endif
00555                 }
00556         }
00557 
00558         EXIT;
00559 out:
00560         if (rc) {
00561 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
00562                 posix_acl_release(md->posix_acl);
00563 #endif
00564         }
00565         return rc;
00566 }
00567 
00568 int mdc_free_lustre_md(struct obd_export *exp, struct lustre_md *md)
00569 {
00570         ENTRY;
00571         RETURN(0);
00572 }
00573 
00574 void mdc_replay_open(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00575 {
00576         struct md_open_data *mod = req->rq_cb_data;
00577         struct ptlrpc_request *close_req;
00578         struct obd_client_handle *och;
00579         struct lustre_handle old;
00580         struct mdt_body *body;
00581         ENTRY;
00582 
00583         if (mod == NULL) {
00584                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req,
00585                           "Can't properly replay without open data.");
00586                 EXIT;
00587                 return;
00588         }
00589 
00590         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00591         LASSERT(body != NULL);
00592 
00593         och = mod->mod_och;
00594         if (och != NULL) {
00595                 struct lustre_handle *file_fh;
00596 
00597                 LASSERT(och->och_magic == OBD_CLIENT_HANDLE_MAGIC);
00598 
00599                 file_fh = &och->och_fh;
00600                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "updating handle from "LPX64" to "LPX64"\n",
00601                        file_fh->cookie, body->mbo_handle.cookie);
00602                 old = *file_fh;
00603                 *file_fh = body->mbo_handle;
00604         }
00605         close_req = mod->mod_close_req;
00606         if (close_req != NULL) {
00607                 __u32 opc = lustre_msg_get_opc(close_req->rq_reqmsg);
00608                 struct mdt_ioepoch *epoch;
00609 
00610                 LASSERT(opc == MDS_CLOSE);
00611                 epoch = req_capsule_client_get(&close_req->rq_pill,
00612                                                &RMF_MDT_EPOCH);
00613                 LASSERT(epoch);
00614 
00615                 if (och != NULL)
00616                         LASSERT(!memcmp(&old, &epoch->mio_handle, sizeof(old)));
00617 
00618                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, close_req, "updating close body with new fh");
00619                 epoch->mio_handle = body->mbo_handle;
00620         }
00621         EXIT;
00622 }
00623 
00624 void mdc_commit_open(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00625 {
00626         struct md_open_data *mod = req->rq_cb_data;
00627         if (mod == NULL)
00628                 return;
00629 
00644         ptlrpc_request_addref(req);
00645         spin_lock(&req->rq_lock);
00646         req->rq_committed = 1;
00647         spin_unlock(&req->rq_lock);
00648         req->rq_cb_data = NULL;
00649         obd_mod_put(mod);
00650 }
00651 
00652 int mdc_set_open_replay_data(struct obd_export *exp,
00653                              struct obd_client_handle *och,
00654                              struct lookup_intent *it)
00655 {
00656         struct md_open_data     *mod;
00657         struct mdt_rec_create   *rec;
00658         struct mdt_body         *body;
00659         struct ptlrpc_request   *open_req = it->it_request;
00660         struct obd_import       *imp = open_req->rq_import;
00661         ENTRY;
00662 
00663         if (!open_req->rq_replay)
00664                 RETURN(0);
00665 
00666         rec = req_capsule_client_get(&open_req->rq_pill, &RMF_REC_REINT);
00667         body = req_capsule_server_get(&open_req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00668         LASSERT(rec != NULL);
00669         /* Incoming message in my byte order (it's been swabbed). */
00670         /* Outgoing messages always in my byte order. */
00671         LASSERT(body != NULL);
00672 
00673         /* Only if the import is replayable, we set replay_open data */
00674         if (och && imp->imp_replayable) {
00675                 mod = obd_mod_alloc();
00676                 if (mod == NULL) {
00677                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, open_req,
00678                                   "Can't allocate md_open_data");
00679                         RETURN(0);
00680                 }
00681 
00688                 obd_mod_get(mod);
00689                 obd_mod_get(mod);
00690 
00691                 spin_lock(&open_req->rq_lock);
00692                 och->och_mod = mod;
00693                 mod->mod_och = och;
00694                 mod->mod_is_create = it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_CREATE) ||
00695                                      it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_STRIPE);
00696                 mod->mod_open_req = open_req;
00697                 open_req->rq_cb_data = mod;
00698                 open_req->rq_commit_cb = mdc_commit_open;
00699                 spin_unlock(&open_req->rq_lock);
00700         }
00701 
00702         rec->cr_fid2 = body->mbo_fid1;
00703         rec->cr_ioepoch = body->mbo_ioepoch;
00704         rec->cr_old_handle.cookie = body->mbo_handle.cookie;
00705         open_req->rq_replay_cb = mdc_replay_open;
00706         if (!fid_is_sane(&body->mbo_fid1)) {
00707                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, open_req, "Saving replay request with "
00708                           "insane fid");
00709                 LBUG();
00710         }
00711 
00712         DEBUG_REQ(D_RPCTRACE, open_req, "Set up open replay data");
00713         RETURN(0);
00714 }
00715 
00716 static void mdc_free_open(struct md_open_data *mod)
00717 {
00718         int committed = 0;
00719 
00720         if (mod->mod_is_create == 0 &&
00721             imp_connect_disp_stripe(mod->mod_open_req->rq_import))
00722                 committed = 1;
00723 
00724         LASSERT(mod->mod_open_req->rq_replay == 0);
00725 
00726         DEBUG_REQ(D_RPCTRACE, mod->mod_open_req, "free open request\n");
00727 
00728         ptlrpc_request_committed(mod->mod_open_req, committed);
00729         if (mod->mod_close_req)
00730                 ptlrpc_request_committed(mod->mod_close_req, committed);
00731 }
00732 
00733 int mdc_clear_open_replay_data(struct obd_export *exp,
00734                                struct obd_client_handle *och)
00735 {
00736         struct md_open_data *mod = och->och_mod;
00737         ENTRY;
00738 
00743         if (mod == NULL)
00744                 RETURN(0);
00745 
00746         LASSERT(mod != LP_POISON);
00747         LASSERT(mod->mod_open_req != NULL);
00748         mdc_free_open(mod);
00749 
00750         mod->mod_och = NULL;
00751         och->och_mod = NULL;
00752         obd_mod_put(mod);
00753 
00754         RETURN(0);
00755 }
00756 
00757 static int mdc_close(struct obd_export *exp, struct md_op_data *op_data,
00758                      struct md_open_data *mod, struct ptlrpc_request **request)
00759 {
00760         struct obd_device     *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00761         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00762         struct req_format     *req_fmt;
00763         int                    rc;
00764         int                    saved_rc = 0;
00765         ENTRY;
00766 
00767         if (op_data->op_bias & MDS_HSM_RELEASE) {
00768                 req_fmt = &RQF_MDS_INTENT_CLOSE;
00769 
00770                 /* allocate a FID for volatile file */
00771                 rc = mdc_fid_alloc(NULL, exp, &op_data->op_fid2, op_data);
00772                 if (rc < 0) {
00773                         CERROR("%s: "DFID" failed to allocate FID: %d\n",
00774                                obd->obd_name, PFID(&op_data->op_fid1), rc);
00775                         /* save the errcode and proceed to close */
00776                         saved_rc = rc;
00777                 }
00778         } else if (op_data->op_bias & MDS_CLOSE_LAYOUT_SWAP) {
00779                 req_fmt = &RQF_MDS_INTENT_CLOSE;
00780         } else {
00781                 req_fmt = &RQF_MDS_CLOSE;
00782         }
00783 
00784         *request = NULL;
00785         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), req_fmt);
00786         if (req == NULL)
00787                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00788 
00789         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_CLOSE);
00790         if (rc) {
00791                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00792                 RETURN(rc);
00793         }
00794 
00795         /* To avoid a livelock (bug 7034), we need to send CLOSE RPCs to a
00796          * portal whose threads are not taking any DLM locks and are therefore
00797          * always progressing */
00798         req->rq_request_portal = MDS_READPAGE_PORTAL;
00799         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
00800 
00801         /* Ensure that this close's handle is fixed up during replay. */
00802         if (likely(mod != NULL)) {
00803                 LASSERTF(mod->mod_open_req != NULL &&
00804                          mod->mod_open_req->rq_type != LI_POISON,
00805                          "POISONED open %p!\n", mod->mod_open_req);
00806 
00807                 mod->mod_close_req = req;
00808 
00809                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, mod->mod_open_req, "matched open");
00810                 /* We no longer want to preserve this open for replay even
00811                  * though the open was committed. b=3632, b=3633 */
00812                 spin_lock(&mod->mod_open_req->rq_lock);
00813                 mod->mod_open_req->rq_replay = 0;
00814                 spin_unlock(&mod->mod_open_req->rq_lock);
00815         } else {
00816                  CDEBUG(D_HA, "couldn't find open req; expecting close error\n");
00817         }
00818 
00819         mdc_close_pack(req, op_data);
00820 
00821         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_MD, RCL_SERVER,
00822                              obd->u.cli.cl_default_mds_easize);
00823 
00824         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00825 
00826         mdc_get_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
00827         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00828         mdc_put_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
00829 
00830         if (req->rq_repmsg == NULL) {
00831                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "request failed to send: %p, %d\n", req,
00832                        req->rq_status);
00833                 if (rc == 0)
00834                         rc = req->rq_status ?: -EIO;
00835         } else if (rc == 0 || rc == -EAGAIN) {
00836                 struct mdt_body *body;
00837 
00838                 rc = lustre_msg_get_status(req->rq_repmsg);
00839                 if (lustre_msg_get_type(req->rq_repmsg) == PTL_RPC_MSG_ERR) {
00840                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "type == PTL_RPC_MSG_ERR, err "
00841                                   "= %d", rc);
00842                         if (rc > 0)
00843                                 rc = -rc;
00844                 }
00845                 body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00846                 if (body == NULL)
00847                         rc = -EPROTO;
00848         } else if (rc == -ESTALE) {
00854                 if (mod) {
00855                         DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "Reset ESTALE = %d", rc);
00856                         LASSERT(mod->mod_open_req != NULL);
00857                         if (mod->mod_open_req->rq_committed)
00858                                 rc = 0;
00859                 }
00860         }
00861 
00862         if (mod) {
00863                 if (rc != 0)
00864                         mod->mod_close_req = NULL;
00865                 /* Since now, mod is accessed through open_req only,
00866                  * thus close req does not keep a reference on mod anymore. */
00867                 obd_mod_put(mod);
00868         }
00869         *request = req;
00870 
00871         RETURN(rc < 0 ? rc : saved_rc);
00872 }
00873 
00874 static int mdc_getpage(struct obd_export *exp, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00875                        u64 offset, struct page **pages, int npages,
00876                        struct ptlrpc_request **request)
00877 {
00878         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00879         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc;
00880         int                      i;
00881         wait_queue_head_t        waitq;
00882         int                      resends = 0;
00883         struct l_wait_info       lwi;
00884         int                      rc;
00885         ENTRY;
00886 
00887         *request = NULL;
00888         init_waitqueue_head(&waitq);
00889 
00890 restart_bulk:
00891         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_MDS_READPAGE);
00892         if (req == NULL)
00893                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00894 
00895         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_READPAGE);
00896         if (rc) {
00897                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00898                 RETURN(rc);
00899         }
00900 
00901         req->rq_request_portal = MDS_READPAGE_PORTAL;
00902         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
00903 
00904         desc = ptlrpc_prep_bulk_imp(req, npages, 1,
00905                                     PTLRPC_BULK_PUT_SINK | PTLRPC_BULK_BUF_KIOV,
00906                                     MDS_BULK_PORTAL,
00907                                     &ptlrpc_bulk_kiov_pin_ops);
00908         if (desc == NULL) {
00909                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00910                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00911         }
00912 
00913         /* NB req now owns desc and will free it when it gets freed */
00914         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++)
00915                 desc->bd_frag_ops->add_kiov_frag(desc, pages[i], 0,
00916                                                  PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00917 
00918         mdc_readdir_pack(req, offset, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE * npages, fid);
00919 
00920         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00921         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00922         if (rc) {
00923                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00924                 if (rc != -ETIMEDOUT)
00925                         RETURN(rc);
00926 
00927                 resends++;
00928                 if (!client_should_resend(resends, &exp->exp_obd->u.cli)) {
00929                         CERROR("%s: too many resend retries: rc = %d\n",
00930                                exp->exp_obd->obd_name, -EIO);
00931                         RETURN(-EIO);
00932                 }
00933                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(cfs_time_seconds(resends), NULL, NULL,
00934                                        NULL);
00935                 l_wait_event(waitq, 0, &lwi);
00936 
00937                 goto restart_bulk;
00938         }
00939 
00940         rc = sptlrpc_cli_unwrap_bulk_read(req, req->rq_bulk,
00941                                           req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred);
00942         if (rc < 0) {
00943                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00944                 RETURN(rc);
00945         }
00946 
00947         if (req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred & ~LU_PAGE_MASK) {
00948                 CERROR("%s: unexpected bytes transferred: %d (%ld expected)\n",
00949                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred,
00950                        PAGE_CACHE_SIZE * npages);
00951                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00952                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00953         }
00954 
00955         *request = req;
00956         RETURN(0);
00957 }
00958 
00959 static void mdc_release_page(struct page *page, int remove)
00960 {
00961         if (remove) {
00962                 lock_page(page);
00963                 if (likely(page->mapping != NULL))
00964                         truncate_complete_page(page->mapping, page);
00965                 unlock_page(page);
00966         }
00967         page_cache_release(page);
00968 }
00969 
00970 static struct page *mdc_page_locate(struct address_space *mapping, __u64 *hash,
00971                                     __u64 *start, __u64 *end, int hash64)
00972 {
00973         /*
00974          * Complement of hash is used as an index so that
00975          * radix_tree_gang_lookup() can be used to find a page with starting
00976          * hash _smaller_ than one we are looking for.
00977          */
00978         unsigned long offset = hash_x_index(*hash, hash64);
00979         struct page *page;
00980         int found;
00981 
00982         spin_lock_irq(&mapping->tree_lock);
00983         found = radix_tree_gang_lookup(&mapping->page_tree,
00984                                        (void **)&page, offset, 1);
00985         if (found > 0 && !radix_tree_exceptional_entry(page)) {
00986                 struct lu_dirpage *dp;
00987 
00988                 page_cache_get(page);
00989                 spin_unlock_irq(&mapping->tree_lock);
00990                 /*
00991                  * In contrast to find_lock_page() we are sure that directory
00992                  * page cannot be truncated (while DLM lock is held) and,
00993                  * hence, can avoid restart.
00994                  *
00995                  * In fact, page cannot be locked here at all, because
00996                  * mdc_read_page_remote does synchronous io.
00997                  */
00998                 wait_on_page_locked(page);
00999                 if (PageUptodate(page)) {
01000                         dp = kmap(page);
01001                         if (BITS_PER_LONG == 32 && hash64) {
01002                                 *start = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_start) >> 32;
01003                                 *end   = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end) >> 32;
01004                                 *hash  = *hash >> 32;
01005                         } else {
01006                                 *start = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_start);
01007                                 *end   = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end);
01008                         }
01009                         if (unlikely(*start == 1 && *hash == 0))
01010                                 *hash = *start;
01011                         else
01012                                 LASSERTF(*start <= *hash, "start = "LPX64
01013                                          ",end = "LPX64",hash = "LPX64"\n",
01014                                          *start, *end, *hash);
01015                         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "offset %lx ["LPX64" "LPX64"],"
01016                               " hash "LPX64"\n", offset, *start, *end, *hash);
01017                         if (*hash > *end) {
01018                                 kunmap(page);
01019                                 mdc_release_page(page, 0);
01020                                 page = NULL;
01021                         } else if (*end != *start && *hash == *end) {
01022                                 /*
01023                                  * upon hash collision, remove this page,
01024                                  * otherwise put page reference, and
01025                                  * mdc_read_page_remote() will issue RPC to
01026                                  * fetch the page we want.
01027                                  */
01028                                 kunmap(page);
01029                                 mdc_release_page(page,
01030                                     le32_to_cpu(dp->ldp_flags) & LDF_COLLIDE);
01031                                 page = NULL;
01032                         }
01033                 } else {
01034                         page_cache_release(page);
01035                         page = ERR_PTR(-EIO);
01036                 }
01037         } else {
01038                 spin_unlock_irq(&mapping->tree_lock);
01039                 page = NULL;
01040         }
01041         return page;
01042 }
01043 
01044 /*
01045  * Adjust a set of pages, each page containing an array of lu_dirpages,
01046  * so that each page can be used as a single logical lu_dirpage.
01047  *
01048  * A lu_dirpage is laid out as follows, where s = ldp_hash_start,
01049  * e = ldp_hash_end, f = ldp_flags, p = padding, and each "ent" is a
01050  * struct lu_dirent.  It has size up to LU_PAGE_SIZE. The ldp_hash_end
01051  * value is used as a cookie to request the next lu_dirpage in a
01052  * directory listing that spans multiple pages (two in this example):
01053  *   ________
01054  *  |        |
01055  * .|--------v-------   -----.
01056  * |s|e|f|p|ent|ent| ... |ent|
01057  * '--|--------------   -----'   Each PAGE contains a single
01058  *    '------.                   lu_dirpage.
01059  * .---------v-------   -----.
01060  * |s|e|f|p|ent| 0 | ... | 0 |
01061  * '-----------------   -----'
01062  *
01063  * However, on hosts where the native VM page size (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) is
01064  * larger than LU_PAGE_SIZE, a single host page may contain multiple
01065  * lu_dirpages. After reading the lu_dirpages from the MDS, the
01066  * ldp_hash_end of the first lu_dirpage refers to the one immediately
01067  * after it in the same PAGE (arrows simplified for brevity, but
01068  * in general e0==s1, e1==s2, etc.):
01069  *
01070  * .--------------------   -----.
01071  * |s0|e0|f0|p|ent|ent| ... |ent|
01072  * |---v----------------   -----|
01073  * |s1|e1|f1|p|ent|ent| ... |ent|
01074  * |---v----------------   -----|  Here, each PAGE contains
01075  *             ...                 multiple lu_dirpages.
01076  * |---v----------------   -----|
01077  * |s'|e'|f'|p|ent|ent| ... |ent|
01078  * '---|----------------   -----'
01079  *     v
01080  * .----------------------------.
01081  * |        next PAGE           |
01082  *
01083  * This structure is transformed into a single logical lu_dirpage as follows:
01084  *
01085  * - Replace e0 with e' so the request for the next lu_dirpage gets the page
01086  *   labeled 'next PAGE'.
01087  *
01088  * - Copy the LDF_COLLIDE flag from f' to f0 to correctly reflect whether
01089  *   a hash collision with the next page exists.
01090  *
01091  * - Adjust the lde_reclen of the ending entry of each lu_dirpage to span
01092  *   to the first entry of the next lu_dirpage.
01093  */
01094 #if PAGE_CACHE_SIZE > LU_PAGE_SIZE
01095 static void mdc_adjust_dirpages(struct page **pages, int cfs_pgs, int lu_pgs)
01096 {
01097         int i;
01098 
01099         for (i = 0; i < cfs_pgs; i++) {
01100                 struct lu_dirpage       *dp = kmap(pages[i]);
01101                 struct lu_dirpage       *first = dp;
01102                 struct lu_dirent        *end_dirent = NULL;
01103                 struct lu_dirent        *ent;
01104                 __u64           hash_end = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end);
01105                 __u32           flags = le32_to_cpu(dp->ldp_flags);
01106 
01107                 while (--lu_pgs > 0) {
01108                         ent = lu_dirent_start(dp);
01109                         for (end_dirent = ent; ent != NULL;
01110                              end_dirent = ent, ent = lu_dirent_next(ent));
01111 
01112                         /* Advance dp to next lu_dirpage. */
01113                         dp = (struct lu_dirpage *)((char *)dp + LU_PAGE_SIZE);
01114 
01115                         /* Check if we've reached the end of the PAGE. */
01116                         if (!((unsigned long)dp & ~PAGE_MASK))
01117                                 break;
01118 
01119                         /* Save the hash and flags of this lu_dirpage. */
01120                         hash_end = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end);
01121                         flags = le32_to_cpu(dp->ldp_flags);
01122 
01123                         /* Check if lu_dirpage contains no entries. */
01124                         if (end_dirent == NULL)
01125                                 break;
01126 
01127                         /* Enlarge the end entry lde_reclen from 0 to
01128                          * first entry of next lu_dirpage. */
01129                         LASSERT(le16_to_cpu(end_dirent->lde_reclen) == 0);
01130                         end_dirent->lde_reclen =
01131                                 cpu_to_le16((char *)(dp->ldp_entries) -
01132                                             (char *)end_dirent);
01133                 }
01134 
01135                 first->ldp_hash_end = hash_end;
01136                 first->ldp_flags &= ~cpu_to_le32(LDF_COLLIDE);
01137                 first->ldp_flags |= flags & cpu_to_le32(LDF_COLLIDE);
01138 
01139                 kunmap(pages[i]);
01140         }
01141         LASSERTF(lu_pgs == 0, "left = %d\n", lu_pgs);
01142 }
01143 #else
01144 #define mdc_adjust_dirpages(pages, cfs_pgs, lu_pgs) do {} while (0)
01145 #endif  /* PAGE_CACHE_SIZE > LU_PAGE_SIZE */
01146 
01147 /* parameters for readdir page */
01148 struct readpage_param {
01149         struct md_op_data       *rp_mod;
01150         __u64                   rp_off;
01151         int                     rp_hash64;
01152         struct obd_export       *rp_exp;
01153         struct md_callback      *rp_cb;
01154 };
01155 
01156 #ifndef HAVE_DELETE_FROM_PAGE_CACHE
01157 static inline void delete_from_page_cache(struct page *page)
01158 {
01159         remove_from_page_cache(page);
01160         page_cache_release(page);
01161 }
01162 #endif
01163 
01174 static int mdc_read_page_remote(void *data, struct page *page0)
01175 {
01176         struct readpage_param   *rp = data;
01177         struct page             **page_pool;
01178         struct page             *page;
01179         struct lu_dirpage       *dp;
01180         int                     rd_pgs = 0; /* number of pages read actually */
01181         int                     npages;
01182         struct md_op_data       *op_data = rp->rp_mod;
01183         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01184         int                     max_pages = op_data->op_max_pages;
01185         struct inode            *inode;
01186         struct lu_fid           *fid;
01187         int                     i;
01188         int                     rc;
01189         ENTRY;
01190 
01191         LASSERT(max_pages > 0 && max_pages <= PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES);
01192         inode = op_data->op_data;
01193         fid = &op_data->op_fid1;
01194         LASSERT(inode != NULL);
01195 
01196         OBD_ALLOC(page_pool, sizeof(page_pool[0]) * max_pages);
01197         if (page_pool != NULL) {
01198                 page_pool[0] = page0;
01199         } else {
01200                 page_pool = &page0;
01201                 max_pages = 1;
01202         }
01203 
01204         for (npages = 1; npages < max_pages; npages++) {
01205                 page = page_cache_alloc_cold(inode->i_mapping);
01206                 if (page == NULL)
01207                         break;
01208                 page_pool[npages] = page;
01209         }
01210 
01211         rc = mdc_getpage(rp->rp_exp, fid, rp->rp_off, page_pool, npages, &req);
01212         if (rc < 0) {
01213                 /* page0 is special, which was added into page cache early */
01214                 delete_from_page_cache(page0);
01215         } else {
01216                 int lu_pgs;
01217 
01218                 rd_pgs = (req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred +
01219                             PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1) >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
01220                 lu_pgs = req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred >>
01221                                                         LU_PAGE_SHIFT;
01222                 LASSERT(!(req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred & ~LU_PAGE_MASK));
01223 
01224                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "read %d(%d) pages\n", rd_pgs, lu_pgs);
01225 
01226                 mdc_adjust_dirpages(page_pool, rd_pgs, lu_pgs);
01227 
01228                 SetPageUptodate(page0);
01229         }
01230         unlock_page(page0);
01231 
01232         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01233         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "read %d/%d pages\n", rd_pgs, npages);
01234         for (i = 1; i < npages; i++) {
01235                 unsigned long   offset;
01236                 __u64           hash;
01237                 int ret;
01238 
01239                 page = page_pool[i];
01240 
01241                 if (rc < 0 || i >= rd_pgs) {
01242                         page_cache_release(page);
01243                         continue;
01244                 }
01245 
01246                 SetPageUptodate(page);
01247 
01248                 dp = kmap(page);
01249                 hash = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_start);
01250                 kunmap(page);
01251 
01252                 offset = hash_x_index(hash, rp->rp_hash64);
01253 
01254                 prefetchw(&page->flags);
01255                 ret = add_to_page_cache_lru(page, inode->i_mapping, offset,
01256                                             GFP_KERNEL);
01257                 if (ret == 0)
01258                         unlock_page(page);
01259                 else
01260                         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "page %lu add to page cache failed:"
01261                                " rc = %d\n", offset, ret);
01262                 page_cache_release(page);
01263         }
01264 
01265         if (page_pool != &page0)
01266                 OBD_FREE(page_pool, sizeof(page_pool[0]) * max_pages);
01267 
01268         RETURN(rc);
01269 }
01270 
01286 static int mdc_read_page(struct obd_export *exp, struct md_op_data *op_data,
01287                          struct md_callback *cb_op, __u64 hash_offset,
01288                          struct page **ppage)
01289 {
01290         struct lookup_intent    it = { .it_op = IT_READDIR };
01291         struct page             *page;
01292         struct inode            *dir = op_data->op_data;
01293         struct address_space    *mapping;
01294         struct lu_dirpage       *dp;
01295         __u64                   start = 0;
01296         __u64                   end = 0;
01297         struct lustre_handle    lockh;
01298         struct ptlrpc_request   *enq_req = NULL;
01299         struct readpage_param   rp_param;
01300         int rc;
01301 
01302         ENTRY;
01303 
01304         *ppage = NULL;
01305 
01306         LASSERT(dir != NULL);
01307         mapping = dir->i_mapping;
01308 
01309         rc = mdc_intent_lock(exp, op_data, &it, &enq_req,
01310                              cb_op->md_blocking_ast, 0);
01311         if (enq_req != NULL)
01312                 ptlrpc_req_finished(enq_req);
01313 
01314         if (rc < 0) {
01315                 CERROR("%s: "DFID" lock enqueue fails: rc = %d\n",
01316                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, PFID(&op_data->op_fid1), rc);
01317                 RETURN(rc);
01318         }
01319 
01320         rc = 0;
01321         mdc_set_lock_data(exp, &it.it_lock_handle, dir, NULL);
01322 
01323         rp_param.rp_off = hash_offset;
01324         rp_param.rp_hash64 = op_data->op_cli_flags & CLI_HASH64;
01325         page = mdc_page_locate(mapping, &rp_param.rp_off, &start, &end,
01326                                rp_param.rp_hash64);
01327         if (IS_ERR(page)) {
01328                 CERROR("%s: dir page locate: "DFID" at "LPU64": rc %ld\n",
01329                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, PFID(&op_data->op_fid1),
01330                        rp_param.rp_off, PTR_ERR(page));
01331                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc = PTR_ERR(page));
01332         } else if (page != NULL) {
01333                 /*
01334                  * XXX nikita: not entirely correct handling of a corner case:
01335                  * suppose hash chain of entries with hash value HASH crosses
01336                  * border between pages P0 and P1. First both P0 and P1 are
01337                  * cached, seekdir() is called for some entry from the P0 part
01338                  * of the chain. Later P0 goes out of cache. telldir(HASH)
01339                  * happens and finds P1, as it starts with matching hash
01340                  * value. Remaining entries from P0 part of the chain are
01341                  * skipped. (Is that really a bug?)
01342                  *
01343                  * Possible solutions: 0. don't cache P1 is such case, handle
01344                  * it as an "overflow" page. 1. invalidate all pages at
01345                  * once. 2. use HASH|1 as an index for P1.
01346                  */
01347                 GOTO(hash_collision, page);
01348         }
01349 
01350         rp_param.rp_exp = exp;
01351         rp_param.rp_mod = op_data;
01352         page = read_cache_page(mapping,
01353                                hash_x_index(rp_param.rp_off,
01354                                             rp_param.rp_hash64),
01355                                mdc_read_page_remote, &rp_param);
01356         if (IS_ERR(page)) {
01357                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: read cache page: "DFID" at "LPU64": %ld\n",
01358                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, PFID(&op_data->op_fid1),
01359                        rp_param.rp_off, PTR_ERR(page));
01360                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc = PTR_ERR(page));
01361         }
01362 
01363         wait_on_page_locked(page);
01364         (void)kmap(page);
01365         if (!PageUptodate(page)) {
01366                 CERROR("%s: page not updated: "DFID" at "LPU64": rc %d\n",
01367                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, PFID(&op_data->op_fid1),
01368                        rp_param.rp_off, -5);
01369                 goto fail;
01370         }
01371         if (!PageChecked(page))
01372                 SetPageChecked(page);
01373         if (PageError(page)) {
01374                 CERROR("%s: page error: "DFID" at "LPU64": rc %d\n",
01375                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, PFID(&op_data->op_fid1),
01376                        rp_param.rp_off, -5);
01377                 goto fail;
01378         }
01379 
01380 hash_collision:
01381         dp = page_address(page);
01382         if (BITS_PER_LONG == 32 && rp_param.rp_hash64) {
01383                 start = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_start) >> 32;
01384                 end   = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end) >> 32;
01385                 rp_param.rp_off = hash_offset >> 32;
01386         } else {
01387                 start = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_start);
01388                 end   = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end);
01389                 rp_param.rp_off = hash_offset;
01390         }
01391         if (end == start) {
01392                 LASSERT(start == rp_param.rp_off);
01393                 CWARN("Page-wide hash collision: %#lx\n", (unsigned long)end);
01394 #if BITS_PER_LONG == 32
01395                 CWARN("Real page-wide hash collision at ["LPU64" "LPU64"] with "
01396                       "hash "LPU64"\n", le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_start),
01397                       le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end), hash_offset);
01398 #endif
01399 
01400                 /*
01401                  * Fetch whole overflow chain...
01402                  *
01403                  * XXX not yet.
01404                  */
01405                 goto fail;
01406         }
01407         *ppage = page;
01408 out_unlock:
01409         lockh.cookie = it.it_lock_handle;
01410         ldlm_lock_decref(&lockh, it.it_lock_mode);
01411         it.it_lock_handle = 0;
01412         return rc;
01413 fail:
01414         kunmap(page);
01415         mdc_release_page(page, 1);
01416         rc = -EIO;
01417         goto out_unlock;
01418 }
01419 
01420 
01421 static int mdc_statfs(const struct lu_env *env,
01422                       struct obd_export *exp, struct obd_statfs *osfs,
01423                       __u64 max_age, __u32 flags)
01424 {
01425         struct obd_device     *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
01426         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
01427         struct obd_statfs     *msfs;
01428         struct obd_import     *imp = NULL;
01429         int                    rc;
01430         ENTRY;
01431 
01432         /*
01433          * Since the request might also come from lprocfs, so we need
01434          * sync this with client_disconnect_export Bug15684
01435          */
01436         down_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
01437         if (obd->u.cli.cl_import)
01438                 imp = class_import_get(obd->u.cli.cl_import);
01439         up_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
01440         if (!imp)
01441                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
01442 
01443         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_MDS_STATFS,
01444                                         LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_STATFS);
01445         if (req == NULL)
01446                 GOTO(output, rc = -ENOMEM);
01447 
01448         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01449 
01450         if (flags & OBD_STATFS_NODELAY) {
01451                 /* procfs requests not want stay in wait for avoid deadlock */
01452                 req->rq_no_resend = 1;
01453                 req->rq_no_delay = 1;
01454         }
01455 
01456         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01457         if (rc) {
01458                 /* check connection error first */
01459                 if (imp->imp_connect_error)
01460                         rc = imp->imp_connect_error;
01461                 GOTO(out, rc);
01462         }
01463 
01464         msfs = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OBD_STATFS);
01465         if (msfs == NULL)
01466                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01467 
01468         *osfs = *msfs;
01469         EXIT;
01470 out:
01471         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01472 output:
01473         class_import_put(imp);
01474         return rc;
01475 }
01476 
01477 static int mdc_ioc_fid2path(struct obd_export *exp, struct getinfo_fid2path *gf)
01478 {
01479         __u32 keylen, vallen;
01480         void *key;
01481         int rc;
01482 
01483         if (gf->gf_pathlen > PATH_MAX)
01484                 RETURN(-ENAMETOOLONG);
01485         if (gf->gf_pathlen < 2)
01486                 RETURN(-EOVERFLOW);
01487 
01488         /* Key is KEY_FID2PATH + getinfo_fid2path description */
01489         keylen = cfs_size_round(sizeof(KEY_FID2PATH) + sizeof(*gf) +
01490                                 sizeof(struct lu_fid));
01491         OBD_ALLOC(key, keylen);
01492         if (key == NULL)
01493                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01494         memcpy(key, KEY_FID2PATH, sizeof(KEY_FID2PATH));
01495         memcpy(key + cfs_size_round(sizeof(KEY_FID2PATH)), gf, sizeof(*gf));
01496         memcpy(key + cfs_size_round(sizeof(KEY_FID2PATH)) + sizeof(*gf),
01497                gf->gf_u.gf_root_fid, sizeof(struct lu_fid));
01498         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "path get "DFID" from "LPU64" #%d\n",
01499                PFID(&gf->gf_fid), gf->gf_recno, gf->gf_linkno);
01500 
01501         if (!fid_is_sane(&gf->gf_fid))
01502                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01503 
01504         /* Val is struct getinfo_fid2path result plus path */
01505         vallen = sizeof(*gf) + gf->gf_pathlen;
01506 
01507         rc = obd_get_info(NULL, exp, keylen, key, &vallen, gf);
01508         if (rc != 0 && rc != -EREMOTE)
01509                 GOTO(out, rc);
01510 
01511         if (vallen <= sizeof(*gf))
01512                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01513         if (vallen > sizeof(*gf) + gf->gf_pathlen)
01514                 GOTO(out, rc = -EOVERFLOW);
01515 
01516         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "path got "DFID" from "LPU64" #%d: %s\n",
01517                PFID(&gf->gf_fid), gf->gf_recno, gf->gf_linkno,
01518                gf->gf_pathlen < 512 ? gf->gf_u.gf_path :
01519                /* only log the last 512 characters of the path */
01520                gf->gf_u.gf_path + gf->gf_pathlen - 512);
01521 
01522 out:
01523         OBD_FREE(key, keylen);
01524         return rc;
01525 }
01526 
01527 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_progress(struct obd_export *exp,
01528                                 struct hsm_progress_kernel *hpk)
01529 {
01530         struct obd_import               *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
01531         struct hsm_progress_kernel      *req_hpk;
01532         struct ptlrpc_request           *req;
01533         int                              rc;
01534         ENTRY;
01535 
01536         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_MDS_HSM_PROGRESS,
01537                                         LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_HSM_PROGRESS);
01538         if (req == NULL)
01539                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01540 
01541         mdc_pack_body(req, NULL, OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM, 0, -1, 0);
01542 
01543         /* Copy hsm_progress struct */
01544         req_hpk = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDS_HSM_PROGRESS);
01545         if (req_hpk == NULL)
01546                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01547 
01548         *req_hpk = *hpk;
01549         req_hpk->hpk_errval = lustre_errno_hton(hpk->hpk_errval);
01550 
01551         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01552 
01553         mdc_get_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
01554         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01555         mdc_put_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
01556 
01557         GOTO(out, rc);
01558 out:
01559         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01560         return rc;
01561 }

01563 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_register(struct obd_import *imp, __u32 archives)
01564 {
01565         __u32                   *archive_mask;
01566         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01567         int                      rc;
01568         ENTRY;
01569 
01570         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_MDS_HSM_CT_REGISTER,
01571                                         LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION,
01572                                         MDS_HSM_CT_REGISTER);
01573         if (req == NULL)
01574                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01575 
01576         mdc_pack_body(req, NULL, OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM, 0, -1, 0);
01577 
01578         /* Copy hsm_progress struct */
01579         archive_mask = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill,
01580                                               &RMF_MDS_HSM_ARCHIVE);
01581         if (archive_mask == NULL)
01582                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01583 
01584         *archive_mask = archives;
01585 
01586         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01587 
01588         rc = mdc_queue_wait(req);
01589         GOTO(out, rc);
01590 out:
01591         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01592         return rc;
01593 }

01595 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_current_action(struct obd_export *exp,
01596                                       struct md_op_data *op_data)
01597 {
01598         struct hsm_current_action       *hca = op_data->op_data;
01599         struct hsm_current_action       *req_hca;
01600         struct ptlrpc_request           *req;
01601         int                              rc;
01602         ENTRY;
01603 
01604         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01605                                    &RQF_MDS_HSM_ACTION);
01606         if (req == NULL)
01607                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01608 
01609         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_HSM_ACTION);
01610         if (rc) {
01611                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01612                 RETURN(rc);
01613         }
01614 
01615         mdc_pack_body(req, &op_data->op_fid1, OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM, 0,
01616                       op_data->op_suppgids[0], 0);
01617 
01618         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01619 
01620         rc = mdc_queue_wait(req);
01621         if (rc)
01622                 GOTO(out, rc);
01623 
01624         req_hca = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill,
01625                                          &RMF_MDS_HSM_CURRENT_ACTION);
01626         if (req_hca == NULL)
01627                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01628 
01629         *hca = *req_hca;
01630 
01631         EXIT;
01632 out:
01633         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01634         return rc;
01635 }

01637 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_unregister(struct obd_import *imp)
01638 {
01639         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01640         int                      rc;
01641         ENTRY;
01642 
01643         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_MDS_HSM_CT_UNREGISTER,
01644                                         LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION,
01645                                         MDS_HSM_CT_UNREGISTER);
01646         if (req == NULL)
01647                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01648 
01649         mdc_pack_body(req, NULL, OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM, 0, -1, 0);
01650 
01651         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01652 
01653         rc = mdc_queue_wait(req);
01654         GOTO(out, rc);
01655 out:
01656         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01657         return rc;
01658 }

01660 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_state_get(struct obd_export *exp,
01661                                  struct md_op_data *op_data)
01662 {
01663         struct hsm_user_state   *hus = op_data->op_data;
01664         struct hsm_user_state   *req_hus;
01665         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01666         int                      rc;
01667         ENTRY;
01668 
01669         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01670                                    &RQF_MDS_HSM_STATE_GET);
01671         if (req == NULL)
01672                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01673 
01674         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_HSM_STATE_GET);
01675         if (rc != 0) {
01676                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01677                 RETURN(rc);
01678         }
01679 
01680         mdc_pack_body(req, &op_data->op_fid1, OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM, 0,
01681                       op_data->op_suppgids[0], 0);
01682 
01683         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01684 
01685         rc = mdc_queue_wait(req);
01686         if (rc)
01687                 GOTO(out, rc);
01688 
01689         req_hus = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_HSM_USER_STATE);
01690         if (req_hus == NULL)
01691                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01692 
01693         *hus = *req_hus;
01694 
01695         EXIT;
01696 out:
01697         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01698         return rc;
01699 }
