01701 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_state_set(struct obd_export *exp,
01702                                  struct md_op_data *op_data)
01703 {
01704         struct hsm_state_set    *hss = op_data->op_data;
01705         struct hsm_state_set    *req_hss;
01706         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01707         int                      rc;
01708         ENTRY;
01709 
01710         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01711                                    &RQF_MDS_HSM_STATE_SET);
01712         if (req == NULL)
01713                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01714 
01715         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_HSM_STATE_SET);
01716         if (rc) {
01717                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01718                 RETURN(rc);
01719         }
01720 
01721         mdc_pack_body(req, &op_data->op_fid1, OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM, 0,
01722                       op_data->op_suppgids[0], 0);
01723 
01724         /* Copy states */
01725         req_hss = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_HSM_STATE_SET);
01726         if (req_hss == NULL)
01727                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01728         *req_hss = *hss;
01729 
01730         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01731 
01732         mdc_get_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
01733         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01734         mdc_put_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
01735 
01736         GOTO(out, rc);
01737 out:
01738         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01739         return rc;
01740 }
01741 
01742 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_request(struct obd_export *exp,
01743                                struct hsm_user_request *hur)
01744 {
01745         struct obd_import       *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
01746         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01747         struct hsm_request      *req_hr;
01748         struct hsm_user_item    *req_hui;
01749         char                    *req_opaque;
01750         int                      rc;
01751         ENTRY;
01752 
01753         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_MDS_HSM_REQUEST);
01754         if (req == NULL)
01755                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01756 
01757         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDS_HSM_USER_ITEM, RCL_CLIENT,
01758                              hur->hur_request.hr_itemcount
01759                              * sizeof(struct hsm_user_item));
01760         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GENERIC_DATA, RCL_CLIENT,
01761                              hur->hur_request.hr_data_len);
01762 
01763         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_HSM_REQUEST);
01764         if (rc) {
01765                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01766                 RETURN(rc);
01767         }
01768 
01769         mdc_pack_body(req, NULL, OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM, 0, -1, 0);
01770 
01771         /* Copy hsm_request struct */
01772         req_hr = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDS_HSM_REQUEST);
01773         if (req_hr == NULL)
01774                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01775         *req_hr = hur->hur_request;
01776 
01777         /* Copy hsm_user_item structs */
01778         req_hui = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDS_HSM_USER_ITEM);
01779         if (req_hui == NULL)
01780                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01781         memcpy(req_hui, hur->hur_user_item,
01782                hur->hur_request.hr_itemcount * sizeof(struct hsm_user_item));
01783 
01784         /* Copy opaque field */
01785         req_opaque = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GENERIC_DATA);
01786         if (req_opaque == NULL)
01787                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01788         memcpy(req_opaque, hur_data(hur), hur->hur_request.hr_data_len);
01789 
01790         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01791 
01792         mdc_get_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
01793         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01794         mdc_put_mod_rpc_slot(req, NULL);
01795 
01796         GOTO(out, rc);
01797 
01798 out:
01799         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01800         return rc;
01801 }
01802 
01803 static struct kuc_hdr *changelog_kuc_hdr(char *buf, size_t len, __u32 flags)
01804 {
01805         struct kuc_hdr *lh = (struct kuc_hdr *)buf;
01806 
01807         LASSERT(len <= KUC_CHANGELOG_MSG_MAXSIZE);
01808 
01809         lh->kuc_magic = KUC_MAGIC;
01810         lh->kuc_transport = KUC_TRANSPORT_CHANGELOG;
01811         lh->kuc_flags = flags;
01812         lh->kuc_msgtype = CL_RECORD;
01813         lh->kuc_msglen = len;
01814         return lh;
01815 }
01816 
01817 struct changelog_show {
01818         __u64                            cs_startrec;
01819         enum changelog_send_flag         cs_flags;
01820         struct file                     *cs_fp;
01821         char                            *cs_buf;
01822         struct obd_device               *cs_obd;
01823 };
01824 
01825 static inline char *cs_obd_name(struct changelog_show *cs)
01826 {
01827         return cs->cs_obd->obd_name;
01828 }
01829 
01830 static int changelog_kkuc_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
01831                              struct llog_rec_hdr *hdr, void *data)
01832 {
01833         struct changelog_show           *cs = data;
01834         struct llog_changelog_rec       *rec = (struct llog_changelog_rec *)hdr;
01835         struct kuc_hdr                  *lh;
01836         size_t                           len;
01837         int                              rc;
01838         ENTRY;
01839 
01840         if (rec->cr_hdr.lrh_type != CHANGELOG_REC) {
01841                 rc = -EINVAL;
01842                 CERROR("%s: not a changelog rec %x/%d: rc = %d\n",
01843                        cs_obd_name(cs), rec->cr_hdr.lrh_type,
01844                        rec->cr.cr_type, rc);
01845                 RETURN(rc);
01846         }
01847 
01848         if (rec->cr.cr_index < cs->cs_startrec) {
01849                 /* Skip entries earlier than what we are interested in */
01850                 CDEBUG(D_HSM, "rec="LPU64" start="LPU64"\n",
01851                        rec->cr.cr_index, cs->cs_startrec);
01852                 RETURN(0);
01853         }
01854 
01855         CDEBUG(D_HSM, LPU64" %02d%-5s "LPU64" 0x%x t="DFID" p="DFID" %.*s\n",
01856                rec->cr.cr_index, rec->cr.cr_type,
01857                changelog_type2str(rec->cr.cr_type), rec->cr.cr_time,
01858                rec->cr.cr_flags & CLF_FLAGMASK,
01859                PFID(&rec->cr.cr_tfid), PFID(&rec->cr.cr_pfid),
01860                rec->cr.cr_namelen, changelog_rec_name(&rec->cr));
01861 
01862         len = sizeof(*lh) + changelog_rec_size(&rec->cr) + rec->cr.cr_namelen;
01863 
01864         /* Set up the message */
01865         lh = changelog_kuc_hdr(cs->cs_buf, len, cs->cs_flags);
01866         memcpy(lh + 1, &rec->cr, len - sizeof(*lh));
01867 
01868         rc = libcfs_kkuc_msg_put(cs->cs_fp, lh);
01869         CDEBUG(D_HSM, "kucmsg fp %p len %zu rc %d\n", cs->cs_fp, len, rc);
01870 
01871         RETURN(rc);
01872 }
01873 
01874 static int mdc_changelog_send_thread(void *csdata)
01875 {
01876         struct changelog_show   *cs = csdata;
01877         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt = NULL;
01878         struct llog_handle      *llh = NULL;
01879         struct kuc_hdr          *kuch;
01880         enum llog_flag           flags = LLOG_F_IS_CAT;
01881         int                      rc;
01882 
01883         CDEBUG(D_HSM, "changelog to fp=%p start "LPU64"\n",
01884                cs->cs_fp, cs->cs_startrec);
01885 
01886         OBD_ALLOC(cs->cs_buf, KUC_CHANGELOG_MSG_MAXSIZE);
01887         if (cs->cs_buf == NULL)
01888                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01889 
01890         /* Set up the remote catalog handle */
01891         ctxt = llog_get_context(cs->cs_obd, LLOG_CHANGELOG_REPL_CTXT);
01892         if (ctxt == NULL)
01893                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
01894         rc = llog_open(NULL, ctxt, &llh, NULL, CHANGELOG_CATALOG,
01895                        LLOG_OPEN_EXISTS);
01896         if (rc) {
01897                 CERROR("%s: fail to open changelog catalog: rc = %d\n",
01898                        cs_obd_name(cs), rc);
01899                 GOTO(out, rc);
01900         }
01901 
01902         if (cs->cs_flags & CHANGELOG_FLAG_JOBID)
01903                 flags |= LLOG_F_EXT_JOBID;
01904 
01905         rc = llog_init_handle(NULL, llh, flags, NULL);
01906         if (rc) {
01907                 CERROR("llog_init_handle failed %d\n", rc);
01908                 GOTO(out, rc);
01909         }
01910 
01911         rc = llog_cat_process(NULL, llh, changelog_kkuc_cb, cs, 0, 0);
01912 
01913         /* Send EOF no matter what our result */
01914         kuch = changelog_kuc_hdr(cs->cs_buf, sizeof(*kuch), cs->cs_flags);
01915         kuch->kuc_msgtype = CL_EOF;
01916         libcfs_kkuc_msg_put(cs->cs_fp, kuch);
01917 
01918 out:
01919         fput(cs->cs_fp);
01920         if (llh)
01921                 llog_cat_close(NULL, llh);
01922         if (ctxt)
01923                 llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01924         if (cs->cs_buf)
01925                 OBD_FREE(cs->cs_buf, KUC_CHANGELOG_MSG_MAXSIZE);
01926         OBD_FREE_PTR(cs);
01927         return rc;
01928 }
01929 
01930 static int mdc_ioc_changelog_send(struct obd_device *obd,
01931                                   struct ioc_changelog *icc)
01932 {
01933         struct changelog_show *cs;
01934         struct task_struct *task;
01935         int rc;
01936 
01937         /* Freed in mdc_changelog_send_thread */
01938         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(cs);
01939         if (!cs)
01940                 return -ENOMEM;
01941 
01942         cs->cs_obd = obd;
01943         cs->cs_startrec = icc->icc_recno;
01944         /* matching fput in mdc_changelog_send_thread */
01945         cs->cs_fp = fget(icc->icc_id);
01946         cs->cs_flags = icc->icc_flags;
01947 
01948         /*
01949          * New thread because we should return to user app before
01950          * writing into our pipe
01951          */
01952         task = kthread_run(mdc_changelog_send_thread, cs,
01953                            "mdc_clg_send_thread");
01954         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
01955                 rc = PTR_ERR(task);
01956                 CERROR("%s: cannot start changelog thread: rc = %d\n",
01957                        cs_obd_name(cs), rc);
01958                 OBD_FREE_PTR(cs);
01959         } else {
01960                 rc = 0;
01961                 CDEBUG(D_HSM, "%s: started changelog thread\n",
01962                        cs_obd_name(cs));
01963         }
01964 
01965         return rc;
01966 }
01967 
01968 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_start(struct obd_export *exp,
01969                                 struct lustre_kernelcomm *lk);
01970 
01971 static int mdc_quotactl(struct obd_device *unused, struct obd_export *exp,
01972                         struct obd_quotactl *oqctl)
01973 {
01974         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01975         struct obd_quotactl     *oqc;
01976         int                      rc;
01977         ENTRY;
01978 
01979         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
01980                                         &RQF_MDS_QUOTACTL, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION,
01981                                         MDS_QUOTACTL);
01982         if (req == NULL)
01983                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01984 
01985         oqc = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OBD_QUOTACTL);
01986         *oqc = *oqctl;
01987 
01988         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01989         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
01990         req->rq_no_resend = 1;
01991 
01992         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01993         if (rc)
01994                 CERROR("ptlrpc_queue_wait failed, rc: %d\n", rc);
01995 
01996         if (req->rq_repmsg &&
01997             (oqc = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OBD_QUOTACTL))) {
01998                 *oqctl = *oqc;
01999         } else if (!rc) {
02000                 CERROR ("Can't unpack obd_quotactl\n");
02001                 rc = -EPROTO;
02002         }
02003         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02004 
02005         RETURN(rc);
02006 }
02007 
02008 static int mdc_ioc_swap_layouts(struct obd_export *exp,
02009                                 struct md_op_data *op_data)
02010 {
02011         struct list_head cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
02012         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
02013         int                      rc, count;
02014         struct mdc_swap_layouts *msl, *payload;
02015         ENTRY;
02016 
02017         msl = op_data->op_data;
02018 
02019         /* When the MDT will get the MDS_SWAP_LAYOUTS RPC the
02020          * first thing it will do is to cancel the 2 layout
02021          * locks held by this client.
02022          * So the client must cancel its layout locks on the 2 fids
02023          * with the request RPC to avoid extra RPC round trips.
02024          */
02025         count = mdc_resource_get_unused(exp, &op_data->op_fid1, &cancels,
02026                                         LCK_EX, MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT |
02027                                         MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR);
02028         count += mdc_resource_get_unused(exp, &op_data->op_fid2, &cancels,
02029                                          LCK_EX, MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT |
02030                                          MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR);
02031 
02032         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
02033                                    &RQF_MDS_SWAP_LAYOUTS);
02034         if (req == NULL) {
02035                 ldlm_lock_list_put(&cancels, l_bl_ast, count);
02036                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02037         }
02038 
02039         rc = mdc_prep_elc_req(exp, req, MDS_SWAP_LAYOUTS, &cancels, count);
02040         if (rc) {
02041                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
02042                 RETURN(rc);
02043         }
02044 
02045         mdc_swap_layouts_pack(req, op_data);
02046 
02047         payload = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SWAP_LAYOUTS);
02048         LASSERT(payload);
02049 
02050         *payload = *msl;
02051 
02052         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02053 
02054         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
02055         if (rc)
02056                 GOTO(out, rc);
02057         EXIT;
02058 
02059 out:
02060         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02061         return rc;
02062 }
02063 
02064 static int mdc_iocontrol(unsigned int cmd, struct obd_export *exp, int len,
02065                          void *karg, void __user *uarg)
02066 {
02067         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
02068         struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
02069         struct obd_import *imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
02070         int rc;
02071         ENTRY;
02072 
02073         if (!try_module_get(THIS_MODULE)) {
02074                 CERROR("%s: cannot get module '%s'\n", obd->obd_name,
02075                        module_name(THIS_MODULE));
02076                 return -EINVAL;
02077         }
02078         switch (cmd) {
02079         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_SEND:
02080                 rc = mdc_ioc_changelog_send(obd, karg);
02081                 GOTO(out, rc);
02082         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_CLEAR: {
02083                 struct ioc_changelog *icc = karg;
02084                 struct changelog_setinfo cs =
02085                         {.cs_recno = icc->icc_recno, .cs_id = icc->icc_id};
02086                 rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, exp, strlen(KEY_CHANGELOG_CLEAR),
02087                                         KEY_CHANGELOG_CLEAR, sizeof(cs), &cs,
02088                                         NULL);
02089                 GOTO(out, rc);
02090         }
02091         case OBD_IOC_FID2PATH:
02092                 rc = mdc_ioc_fid2path(exp, karg);
02093                 GOTO(out, rc);
02094         case LL_IOC_HSM_CT_START:
02095                 rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_start(exp, karg);
02096                 /* ignore if it was already registered on this MDS. */
02097                 if (rc == -EEXIST)
02098                         rc = 0;
02099                 GOTO(out, rc);
02100         case LL_IOC_HSM_PROGRESS:
02101                 rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_progress(exp, karg);
02102                 GOTO(out, rc);
02103         case LL_IOC_HSM_STATE_GET:
02104                 rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_state_get(exp, karg);
02105                 GOTO(out, rc);
02106         case LL_IOC_HSM_STATE_SET:
02107                 rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_state_set(exp, karg);
02108                 GOTO(out, rc);
02109         case LL_IOC_HSM_ACTION:
02110                 rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_current_action(exp, karg);
02111                 GOTO(out, rc);
02112         case LL_IOC_HSM_REQUEST:
02113                 rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_request(exp, karg);
02114                 GOTO(out, rc);
02115         case OBD_IOC_CLIENT_RECOVER:
02116                 rc = ptlrpc_recover_import(imp, data->ioc_inlbuf1, 0);
02117                 if (rc < 0)
02118                         GOTO(out, rc);
02119                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02120         case IOC_OSC_SET_ACTIVE:
02121                 rc = ptlrpc_set_import_active(imp, data->ioc_offset);
02122                 GOTO(out, rc);
02123         case OBD_IOC_PING_TARGET:
02124                 rc = ptlrpc_obd_ping(obd);
02125                 GOTO(out, rc);
02126         /*
02127          * Normally IOC_OBD_STATFS, OBD_IOC_QUOTACTL iocontrol are handled by
02128          * LMV instead of MDC. But when the cluster is upgraded from 1.8,
02129          * there'd be no LMV layer thus we might be called here. Eventually
02130          * this code should be removed.
02131          * bz20731, LU-592.
02132          */
02133         case IOC_OBD_STATFS: {
02134                 struct obd_statfs stat_buf = {0};
02135 
02136                 if (*((__u32 *) data->ioc_inlbuf2) != 0)
02137                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
02138 
02139                 /* copy UUID */
02140                 if (copy_to_user(data->ioc_pbuf2, obd2cli_tgt(obd),
02141                                  min((int)data->ioc_plen2,
02142                                      (int)sizeof(struct obd_uuid))))
02143                         GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
02144 
02145                 rc = mdc_statfs(NULL, obd->obd_self_export, &stat_buf,
02146                                 cfs_time_shift_64(-OBD_STATFS_CACHE_SECONDS),
02147                                 0);
02148                 if (rc != 0)
02149                         GOTO(out, rc);
02150 
02151                 if (copy_to_user(data->ioc_pbuf1, &stat_buf,
02152                                      min((int) data->ioc_plen1,
02153                                          (int) sizeof(stat_buf))))
02154                         GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
02155 
02156                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02157         }
02158         case OBD_IOC_QUOTACTL: {
02159                 struct if_quotactl *qctl = karg;
02160                 struct obd_quotactl *oqctl;
02161 
02162                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oqctl);
02163                 if (oqctl == NULL)
02164                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
02165 
02166                 QCTL_COPY(oqctl, qctl);
02167                 rc = obd_quotactl(exp, oqctl);
02168                 if (rc == 0) {
02169                         QCTL_COPY(qctl, oqctl);
02170                         qctl->qc_valid = QC_MDTIDX;
02171                         qctl->obd_uuid = obd->u.cli.cl_target_uuid;
02172                 }
02173 
02174                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oqctl);
02175                 GOTO(out, rc);
02176         }
02177         case LL_IOC_GET_CONNECT_FLAGS:
02178                 if (copy_to_user(uarg, exp_connect_flags_ptr(exp),
02179                                  sizeof(*exp_connect_flags_ptr(exp))))
02180                         GOTO(out, rc = -EFAULT);
02181 
02182                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02183         case LL_IOC_LOV_SWAP_LAYOUTS:
02184                 rc = mdc_ioc_swap_layouts(exp, karg);
02185                 GOTO(out, rc);
02186         default:
02187                 CERROR("unrecognised ioctl: cmd = %#x\n", cmd);
02188                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTTY);
02189         }
02190 out:
02191         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
02192 
02193         return rc;
02194 }
02195 
02196 static int mdc_get_info_rpc(struct obd_export *exp,
02197                             u32 keylen, void *key,
02198                             u32 vallen, void *val)
02199 {
02200         struct obd_import      *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
02201         struct ptlrpc_request  *req;
02202         char                   *tmp;
02203         int                     rc = -EINVAL;
02204         ENTRY;
02205 
02206         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_MDS_GET_INFO);
02207         if (req == NULL)
02208                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02209 
02210         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_KEY,
02211                              RCL_CLIENT, keylen);
02212         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_VALLEN,
02213                              RCL_CLIENT, sizeof(vallen));
02214 
02215         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_GET_INFO);
02216         if (rc) {
02217                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
02218                 RETURN(rc);
02219         }
02220 
02221         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_KEY);
02222         memcpy(tmp, key, keylen);
02223         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_VALLEN);
02224         memcpy(tmp, &vallen, sizeof(vallen));
02225 
02226         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_VAL,
02227                              RCL_SERVER, vallen);
02228         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02229 
02230         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
02231         /* -EREMOTE means the get_info result is partial, and it needs to
02232          * continue on another MDT, see fid2path part in lmv_iocontrol */
02233         if (rc == 0 || rc == -EREMOTE) {
02234                 tmp = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_VAL);
02235                 memcpy(val, tmp, vallen);
02236                 if (ptlrpc_rep_need_swab(req)) {
02237                         if (KEY_IS(KEY_FID2PATH))
02238                                 lustre_swab_fid2path(val);
02239                 }
02240         }
02241         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02242 
02243         RETURN(rc);
02244 }
02245 
02246 static void lustre_swab_hai(struct hsm_action_item *h)
02247 {
02248         __swab32s(&h->hai_len);
02249         __swab32s(&h->hai_action);
02250         lustre_swab_lu_fid(&h->hai_fid);
02251         lustre_swab_lu_fid(&h->hai_dfid);
02252         __swab64s(&h->hai_cookie);
02253         __swab64s(&h->hai_extent.offset);
02254         __swab64s(&h->hai_extent.length);
02255         __swab64s(&h->hai_gid);
02256 }
02257 
02258 static void lustre_swab_hal(struct hsm_action_list *h)
02259 {
02260         struct hsm_action_item  *hai;
02261         __u32                    i;
02262 
02263         __swab32s(&h->hal_version);
02264         __swab32s(&h->hal_count);
02265         __swab32s(&h->hal_archive_id);
02266         __swab64s(&h->hal_flags);
02267         hai = hai_first(h);
02268         for (i = 0; i < h->hal_count; i++, hai = hai_next(hai))
02269                 lustre_swab_hai(hai);
02270 }
02271 
02272 static void lustre_swab_kuch(struct kuc_hdr *l)
02273 {
02274         __swab16s(&l->kuc_magic);
02275         /* __u8 l->kuc_transport */
02276         __swab16s(&l->kuc_msgtype);
02277         __swab16s(&l->kuc_msglen);
02278 }
02279 
02280 static int mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_start(struct obd_export *exp,
02281                                 struct lustre_kernelcomm *lk)
02282 {
02283         struct obd_import  *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
02284         __u32               archive = lk->lk_data;
02285         int                 rc = 0;
02286 
02287         if (lk->lk_group != KUC_GRP_HSM) {
02288                 CERROR("Bad copytool group %d\n", lk->lk_group);
02289                 return -EINVAL;
02290         }
02291 
02292         CDEBUG(D_HSM, "CT start r%d w%d u%d g%d f%#x\n", lk->lk_rfd, lk->lk_wfd,
02293                lk->lk_uid, lk->lk_group, lk->lk_flags);
02294 
02295         if (lk->lk_flags & LK_FLG_STOP) {
02296                 /* Unregister with the coordinator */
02297                 rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_unregister(imp);
02298         } else {
02299                 rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_register(imp, archive);
02300         }
02301 
02302         return rc;
02303 }
02304 
02310 static int mdc_hsm_copytool_send(size_t len, void *val)
02311 {
02312         struct kuc_hdr          *lh = (struct kuc_hdr *)val;
02313         struct hsm_action_list  *hal = (struct hsm_action_list *)(lh + 1);
02314         int                      rc;
02315         ENTRY;
02316 
02317         if (len < sizeof(*lh) + sizeof(*hal)) {
02318                 CERROR("Short HSM message %zu < %zu\n", len,
02319                        sizeof(*lh) + sizeof(*hal));
02320                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
02321         }
02322         if (lh->kuc_magic == __swab16(KUC_MAGIC)) {
02323                 lustre_swab_kuch(lh);
02324                 lustre_swab_hal(hal);
02325         } else if (lh->kuc_magic != KUC_MAGIC) {
02326                 CERROR("Bad magic %x!=%x\n", lh->kuc_magic, KUC_MAGIC);
02327                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
02328         }
02329 
02330         CDEBUG(D_HSM, " Received message mg=%x t=%d m=%d l=%d actions=%d "
02331                "on %s\n",
02332                lh->kuc_magic, lh->kuc_transport, lh->kuc_msgtype,
02333                lh->kuc_msglen, hal->hal_count, hal->hal_fsname);
02334 
02335         /* Broadcast to HSM listeners */
02336         rc = libcfs_kkuc_group_put(KUC_GRP_HSM, lh);
02337 
02338         RETURN(rc);
02339 }
02340 
02347 static int mdc_hsm_ct_reregister(void *data, void *cb_arg)
02348 {
02349         struct kkuc_ct_data     *kcd = data;
02350         struct obd_import       *imp = (struct obd_import *)cb_arg;
02351         int                      rc;
02352 
02353         if (kcd == NULL || kcd->kcd_magic != KKUC_CT_DATA_MAGIC)
02354                 return -EPROTO;
02355 
02356         if (!obd_uuid_equals(&kcd->kcd_uuid, &imp->imp_obd->obd_uuid))
02357                 return 0;
02358 
02359         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: recover copytool registration to MDT (archive=%#x)\n",
02360                imp->imp_obd->obd_name, kcd->kcd_archive);
02361         rc = mdc_ioc_hsm_ct_register(imp, kcd->kcd_archive);
02362 
02363         /* ignore error if the copytool is already registered */
02364         return (rc == -EEXIST) ? 0 : rc;
02365 }
02366 
02371 static int mdc_kuc_reregister(struct obd_import *imp)
02372 {
02373         /* re-register HSM agents */
02374         return libcfs_kkuc_group_foreach(KUC_GRP_HSM, mdc_hsm_ct_reregister,
02375                                          (void *)imp);
02376 }
02377 
02378 static int mdc_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env,
02379                               struct obd_export *exp,
02380                               u32 keylen, void *key,
02381                               u32 vallen, void *val,
02382                               struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
02383 {
02384         struct obd_import       *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
02385         int                      rc;
02386         ENTRY;
02387 
02388         if (KEY_IS(KEY_READ_ONLY)) {
02389                 if (vallen != sizeof(int))
02390                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02391 
02392                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
02393                 if (*((int *)val)) {
02394                         imp->imp_connect_flags_orig |= OBD_CONNECT_RDONLY;
02395                         imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags |=
02396                                                         OBD_CONNECT_RDONLY;
02397                 } else {
02398                         imp->imp_connect_flags_orig &= ~OBD_CONNECT_RDONLY;
02399                         imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags &=
02400                                                         ~OBD_CONNECT_RDONLY;
02401                 }
02402                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
02403 
02404                 rc = do_set_info_async(imp, MDS_SET_INFO, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION,
02405                                        keylen, key, vallen, val, set);
02406                 RETURN(rc);
02407         }
02408         if (KEY_IS(KEY_SPTLRPC_CONF)) {
02409                 sptlrpc_conf_client_adapt(exp->exp_obd);
02410                 RETURN(0);
02411         }
02412         if (KEY_IS(KEY_FLUSH_CTX)) {
02413                 sptlrpc_import_flush_my_ctx(imp);
02414                 RETURN(0);
02415         }
02416         if (KEY_IS(KEY_CHANGELOG_CLEAR)) {
02417                 rc = do_set_info_async(imp, MDS_SET_INFO, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION,
02418                                        keylen, key, vallen, val, set);
02419                 RETURN(rc);
02420         }
02421         if (KEY_IS(KEY_HSM_COPYTOOL_SEND)) {
02422                 rc = mdc_hsm_copytool_send(vallen, val);
02423                 RETURN(rc);
02424         }
02425 
02426         if (KEY_IS(KEY_DEFAULT_EASIZE)) {
02427                 __u32 *default_easize = val;
02428 
02429                 exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_default_mds_easize = *default_easize;
02430                 RETURN(0);
02431         }
02432 
02433         CERROR("Unknown key %s\n", (char *)key);
02434         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02435 }
02436 
02437 static int mdc_get_info(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
02438                         __u32 keylen, void *key, __u32 *vallen, void *val)
02439 {
02440         int rc = -EINVAL;
02441 
02442         if (KEY_IS(KEY_MAX_EASIZE)) {
02443                 __u32 mdsize, *max_easize;
02444 
02445                 if (*vallen != sizeof(int))
02446                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02447                 mdsize = *(__u32 *)val;
02448                 if (mdsize > exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_max_mds_easize)
02449                         exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_max_mds_easize = mdsize;
02450                 max_easize = val;
02451                 *max_easize = exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_max_mds_easize;
02452                 RETURN(0);
02453         } else if (KEY_IS(KEY_DEFAULT_EASIZE)) {
02454                 __u32 *default_easize;
02455 
02456                 if (*vallen != sizeof(int))
02457                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02458                 default_easize = val;
02459                 *default_easize = exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_default_mds_easize;
02460                 RETURN(0);
02461         } else if (KEY_IS(KEY_CONN_DATA)) {
02462                 struct obd_import *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
02463                 struct obd_connect_data *data = val;
02464 
02465                 if (*vallen != sizeof(*data))
02466                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02467 
02468                 *data = imp->imp_connect_data;
02469                 RETURN(0);
02470         } else if (KEY_IS(KEY_TGT_COUNT)) {
02471                 *((__u32 *)val) = 1;
02472                 RETURN(0);
02473         }
02474 
02475         rc = mdc_get_info_rpc(exp, keylen, key, *vallen, val);
02476 
02477         RETURN(rc);
02478 }
02479 
02480 static int mdc_fsync(struct obd_export *exp, const struct lu_fid *fid,
02481                      struct ptlrpc_request **request)
02482 {
02483         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
02484         int                    rc;
02485         ENTRY;
02486 
02487         *request = NULL;
02488         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_MDS_SYNC);
02489         if (req == NULL)
02490                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02491 
02492         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_SYNC);
02493         if (rc) {
02494                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
02495                 RETURN(rc);
02496         }
02497 
02498         mdc_pack_body(req, fid, 0, 0, -1, 0);
02499 
02500         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02501 
02502         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
02503         if (rc)
02504                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02505         else
02506                 *request = req;
02507         RETURN(rc);
02508 }
02509 
02510 static int mdc_import_event(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_import *imp,
02511                             enum obd_import_event event)
02512 {
02513         int rc = 0;
02514 
02515         LASSERT(imp->imp_obd == obd);
02516 
02517         switch (event) {
02518         case IMP_EVENT_DISCON: {
02519 #if 0
02520                 /* XXX Pass event up to OBDs stack. used only for FLD now */
02521                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_DISCON, NULL);
02522 #endif
02523                 break;
02524         }
02525         case IMP_EVENT_INACTIVE: {
02526                 struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
02527                 /*
02528                  * Flush current sequence to make client obtain new one
02529                  * from server in case of disconnect/reconnect.
02530                  */
02531                 if (cli->cl_seq != NULL)
02532                         seq_client_flush(cli->cl_seq);
02533 
02534                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_INACTIVE, NULL);
02535                 break;
02536         }
02537         case IMP_EVENT_INVALIDATE: {
02538                 struct ldlm_namespace *ns = obd->obd_namespace;
02539 
02540                 ldlm_namespace_cleanup(ns, LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY);
02541 
02542                 break;
02543         }
02544         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVE:
02545                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVE, NULL);
02546                 /* redo the kuc registration after reconnecting */
02547                 if (rc == 0)
02548                         rc = mdc_kuc_reregister(imp);
02549                 break;
02550         case IMP_EVENT_OCD:
02551                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_OCD, NULL);
02552                 break;
02553         case IMP_EVENT_DEACTIVATE:
02554         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVATE:
02555                 break;
02556         default:
02557                 CERROR("Unknown import event %x\n", event);
02558                 LBUG();
02559         }
02560         RETURN(rc);
02561 }
02562 
02563 int mdc_fid_alloc(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
02564                   struct lu_fid *fid, struct md_op_data *op_data)
02565 {
02566         struct client_obd *cli = &exp->exp_obd->u.cli;
02567         struct lu_client_seq *seq = cli->cl_seq;
02568         ENTRY;
02569         RETURN(seq_client_alloc_fid(env, seq, fid));
02570 }

02572 static struct obd_uuid *mdc_get_uuid(struct obd_export *exp)
02573 {
02574         struct client_obd *cli = &exp->exp_obd->u.cli;
02575         return &cli->cl_target_uuid;
02576 }
02577 
02583 static int mdc_cancel_weight(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
02584 {
02585         if (lock->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_IBITS)
02586                 RETURN(0);
02587 
02588         /* FIXME: if we ever get into a situation where there are too many
02589          * opened files with open locks on a single node, then we really
02590          * should replay these open locks to reget it */
02591         if (lock->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits & MDS_INODELOCK_OPEN)
02592                 RETURN(0);
02593 
02594         RETURN(1);
02595 }
02596 
02597 static int mdc_resource_inode_free(struct ldlm_resource *res)
02598 {
02599         if (res->lr_lvb_inode)
02600                 res->lr_lvb_inode = NULL;
02601 
02602         return 0;
02603 }
02604 
02605 static struct ldlm_valblock_ops inode_lvbo = {
02606         .lvbo_free = mdc_resource_inode_free
02607 };
02608 
02609 static int mdc_llog_init(struct obd_device *obd)
02610 {
02611         struct obd_llog_group   *olg = &obd->obd_olg;
02612         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
02613         int                      rc;
02614 
02615         ENTRY;
02616 
02617         rc = llog_setup(NULL, obd, olg, LLOG_CHANGELOG_REPL_CTXT, obd,
02618                         &llog_client_ops);
02619         if (rc < 0)
02620                 RETURN(rc);
02621 
02622         ctxt = llog_group_get_ctxt(olg, LLOG_CHANGELOG_REPL_CTXT);
02623         llog_initiator_connect(ctxt);
02624         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
02625 
02626         RETURN(0);
02627 }
02628 
02629 static void mdc_llog_finish(struct obd_device *obd)
02630 {
02631         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
02632 
02633         ENTRY;
02634 
02635         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CHANGELOG_REPL_CTXT);
02636         if (ctxt != NULL)
02637                 llog_cleanup(NULL, ctxt);
02638 
02639         EXIT;
02640 }
02641 
02642 static int mdc_setup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
02643 {
02644         int                             rc;
02645         ENTRY;
02646 
02647         rc = ptlrpcd_addref();
02648         if (rc < 0)
02649                 RETURN(rc);
02650 
02651         rc = client_obd_setup(obd, cfg);
02652         if (rc)
02653                 GOTO(err_ptlrpcd_decref, rc);
02654 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
02655         obd->obd_vars = lprocfs_mdc_obd_vars;
02656         lprocfs_obd_setup(obd);
02657         lprocfs_alloc_md_stats(obd, 0);
02658 #endif
02659         sptlrpc_lprocfs_cliobd_attach(obd);
02660         ptlrpc_lprocfs_register_obd(obd);
02661 
02662         ns_register_cancel(obd->obd_namespace, mdc_cancel_weight);
02663 
02664         obd->obd_namespace->ns_lvbo = &inode_lvbo;
02665 
02666         rc = mdc_llog_init(obd);
02667         if (rc) {
02668                 mdc_cleanup(obd);
02669                 CERROR("failed to setup llogging subsystems\n");
02670                 RETURN(rc);
02671         }
02672 
02673         RETURN(rc);
02674 
02675 err_ptlrpcd_decref:
02676         ptlrpcd_decref();
02677         RETURN(rc);
02678 }
02679 
02680 /* Initialize the default and maximum LOV EA sizes.  This allows
02681  * us to make MDS RPCs with large enough reply buffers to hold a default
02682  * sized EA without having to calculate this (via a call into the
02683  * LOV + OSCs) each time we make an RPC.  The maximum size is also tracked
02684  * but not used to avoid wastefully vmalloc()'ing large reply buffers when
02685  * a large number of stripes is possible.  If a larger reply buffer is
02686  * required it will be reallocated in the ptlrpc layer due to overflow.
02687  */
02688 static int mdc_init_ea_size(struct obd_export *exp, __u32 easize,
02689                             __u32 def_easize)
02690 {
02691         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
02692         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
02693         ENTRY;
02694 
02695         if (cli->cl_max_mds_easize < easize)
02696                 cli->cl_max_mds_easize = easize;
02697 
02698         if (cli->cl_default_mds_easize < def_easize)
02699                 cli->cl_default_mds_easize = def_easize;
02700 
02701         RETURN(0);
02702 }
02703 
02704 static int mdc_precleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
02705 {
02706         ENTRY;
02707 
02708         /* Failsafe, ok if racy */
02709         if (obd->obd_type->typ_refcnt <= 1)
02710                 libcfs_kkuc_group_rem(0, KUC_GRP_HSM);
02711 
02712         obd_cleanup_client_import(obd);
02713         ptlrpc_lprocfs_unregister_obd(obd);
02714         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(obd);
02715         lprocfs_free_md_stats(obd);
02716         mdc_llog_finish(obd);
02717         RETURN(0);
02718 }
02719 
02720 static int mdc_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
02721 {
02722         ptlrpcd_decref();
02723 
02724         return client_obd_cleanup(obd);
02725 }
02726 
02727 static int mdc_process_config(struct obd_device *obd, size_t len, void *buf)
02728 {
02729         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg = buf;
02730         int rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_MDC, obd->obd_vars, lcfg, obd);
02731         return (rc > 0 ? 0: rc);
02732 }
02733 
02734 
02735 /* get remote permission for current user on fid */
02736 static int mdc_get_remote_perm(struct obd_export *exp, const struct lu_fid *fid,
02737                                u32 suppgid, struct ptlrpc_request **request)
02738 {
02739         struct ptlrpc_request  *req;
02740         int                    rc;
02741         ENTRY;
02742 
02743         LASSERT(client_is_remote(exp));
02744 
02745         *request = NULL;
02746         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_MDS_GETATTR);
02747         if (req == NULL)
02748                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02749 
02750         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_GETATTR);
02751         if (rc) {
02752                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
02753                 RETURN(rc);
02754         }
02755 
02756         mdc_pack_body(req, fid, OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM, 0, suppgid, 0);
02757 
02758         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_ACL, RCL_SERVER,
02759                              sizeof(struct mdt_remote_perm));
02760 
02761         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02762 
02763         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
02764         if (rc)
02765                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02766         else
02767                 *request = req;
02768         RETURN(rc);
02769 }
